intro: Icacorea eugenioides, commonly known as the silky oaks, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soils. Icacorea eugenioides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
